title: How do authors have so many people to thank in the acknowledgement? - Quora

response.answer_text: Authors usually need a lot of research to come up with their words that go into a book. While it depends from author to author and from book to book, the more the research, the more an author would feel obliged to thank people who were a part of the research process.

Richard Lowe provides a good pre-publication list of contributors. Most of the other thank yous I see are for people in the company or corporation that publishes the book and the support team for the book such as: AgentEditorArtistLawyerAccountantPromotion teamOffice help in whatever capacity such as assistant efitors, coaching people, University aids to look up credentials, etc.There's a lot of people that contribute to the success of a book.
